author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ALVIN DEGENERATES TO A REMNANT LOW... ...SWELLS AND RIP CURRENTS POSSIBLE ALONG PORTIONS OF THE COASTS OF WEST-CENTRAL MAINLAND MEXICO AND SOUTHERN BAJA CALIFORNIA THIS WEEKEND...
summary: ...ALVIN DEGENERATES TO A REMNANT LOW... ...SWELLS AND RIP CURRENTS POSSIBLE ALONG PORTIONS OF THE COASTS OF WEST-CENTRAL MAINLAND MEXICO AND SOUTHERN BAJA CALIFORNIA THIS WEEKEND... As of 8:00 AM MST Sat May 31 the center of Alvin was located near 20.7, -109.5 with movement N at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ALVIN DEGENERATES TO A REMNANT LOW... ...SWELLS AND RIP CURRENTS POSSIBLE ALONG PORTIONS OF THE COASTS OF WEST-CENTRAL MAINLAND MEXICO AND SOUTHERN BAJA CALIFORNIA THIS WEEKEND... As of 8:00 AM MST Sat May 31 the center of Alvin was located near 20.7, -109.5 with movement N at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

title: Summary for Post-Tropical Cyclone Alvin (EP1/EP012025)
